data.title: Many Packages With File Mapping Error
data.body:
I see a number of error messages in the Developer Tools Console for several packages. One example is:

```
Failed to locate workspace file mapped to URL file:///Users/bob/Dropbox/Application%20Support/.atom/packages/atom-color-highlight/lib/atom-color-highlight-view.coffee from source map file:///Users/bob/Dropbox/Application%20Support/.atom/packages/atom-color-highlight/lib/atom-color-highlight-view.coffee
```

But many packages have a similar error, so I wonder if it's something about Atom 0.165.0? Here are the packages showing errors:
preview-tabs
project-pallete-finder
markdown-table-formatter
atom-color-highlight
linter
tabs-to-spaces
autocomplete-plus
indentation-indicator
color-picker
file-icons
less-than-slash
autoclose-html
recent-files

data.title: A JavaScript error occured in the browser process
data.body:
Uncaught Exception:
Error: EPERM, operation not permitted '/tmp/atom.sock'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.unlinkSync (fs.js:807:18)
    at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.deleteSocketFile (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:193:21)
    at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.listenForArgumentsFromNewProcess (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:172:12)
    at new AtomApplication (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:88:12)
    at Socket.createAtomApplication (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:43:16)
    at Socket.emit (events.js:107:17)
    at net.js:436:14
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:378:11)

Whenever I try to start atom, I get this error.

Running on: Archlinux 64 bit.
Atom version is 0.165.0-1

data.title: Display count of multiple cursors in status bar
data.body: When there are multiple cursors it would be useful to know how many there are. Maybe it could be displayed in the status bar near the row and column. Maybe this is a package, though.

data.title: Fix LanguageMode::foldAllAtIndentLevel
data.body: Currently, after folding at indent level `n`, folding at any indent level > `n` doesn't work. This fixes that.

data.title: alt-f and alt-h default keybindings
data.body:
By default, alt-f is bound to `editor:move-to-end-of-word` and alt-h to `editor:delete-to-beginning-of-word`. These conflict with activating `File` and `Help` menus in Windows. 

Suggestions:
- Reserve alt-f and alt-h for menu bar access and change editor shortcuts.
- Focus and activate menu bar via a single alt press so user can navigate through the menus using arrow keys (customary behavior in Windows).

data.title: Don't write the config to disk so darn often
data.body:
Two problems:
- When we started using `Config::set` for all settings (rather than `::addScopedProperties` et al), we accidentally introduced a lot more writes of the config to disk, particularly when initially loading packages. We shouldn't be saving the user's config to disk when we're using a `source` other than the user's config file.
- The settings-view calls `::set` _a lot_. This ought to be ok. We don't need to synchronously save the config every time set is called. We should throttle the writes.

Fixes #4770.

data.title: Load package settings from `settings` directory and deprecate `scoped-properties`
data.body: Refs #4605

data.title: Most pane text is not selectable.
data.body: I have noticed in a number of packages with dialogs that the text can't be selected and copied.  This is true with my packages also.  I admit I haven't tried to fix it but even if there is a simple fix I'm curious why this is a default that every package has to fix?

data.title: Has branch, getShortHead returns null on fresh repository
data.body: Hi, If I have fresh repository with no commits functions like hasBranch('master') or getShortHead() returns null which seems like mistake. When I looked at the code atom seems to be checking refs/heads folder inside of .git which is empty if there are not commits.

data.title: Drive names in paths appear lowercase
data.body:
Full paths such as `c:\Users\Foobar\Desktop\baz.txt`
The convention in windows is to have drive names in uppercase (`C:\`)

data.title: Failed to spawn undefined
data.body:
Hi,

This beautiful error spawn each time I reopen a closed project...

![error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4070933/5569533/b673e71a-8f72-11e4-991e-296c07f9c560.png)

Most of the time, there is a message like this per reopened tab:

```
Uncaught BufferedProcessError: Failed to spawn command `undefined`. Make sure `undefined` is installed and on your PATH
```

I am running Atom 0.165.0 on OSX 10.10.2

Thank for any help and happy new year

data.body: Currently I can right-click on a tab and select `Close All Tabs` can this and similar commands be added to the command palette?

```
  at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:243:29)
  at /opt/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:3:61
  at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.dispatchCommandEvent (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:549:16)
  at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:391:22)
  at HTMLDocument.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.onKeydown (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/window-event-handler.js:167:20)

```

data.title: Going through main navigation makes Atom unresponsive
data.body:
Atom: 0.165.0 (from ppa:webupd8team/atom)
OS: Ubuntu Gnome 14.04.1, gnome-shell 3.12.2

Main navigation is pretty slow. Also when I move between File to Help via mouse app becomes unresponsive and I can kill it only. No errors either in Developer Console and os console.

Tested in normal and --safe mode. Issue occurs in both.
